title: About
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: ISSS608-VAA
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Application. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text: In this chapter, you will learn the basic principles and essential components of ggplot2. At the same time, you will gain hands-on experience on using these components to plot statistical graphics based on the principle of Layered Grammar of Graphics. By then end of this chapter you will be able to apply the essential graphical elements provided by ggplot2 to create elegant and yet functional statistical graphics.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.2.1 Install and launching R packages
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.2.2 Importing the data

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.3.1 R Graphics VS ggplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="black", 
                 fill="grey") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.5 Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Aesthetic mappings
text:
1.5 Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Aesthetic mappings

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS))

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.1 Geometric Objects: geom_bar

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.2 Geometric Objects: geom_dotplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5)

Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with
`binwidth`.










ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,         
               dotsize = 0.5) +      
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,           
                     breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.3 Geometric Objects: geom_histogram()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram()       

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value `binwidth`.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.6.4 Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()
text:
1.6.4 Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light blue")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.6.5 Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()
text:
1.6.5 Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.6 Geometric Objects: geom-density()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.7 Geometric Objects: geom_boxplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS,       
           x= GENDER)) +    
  geom_boxplot()            









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch=TRUE)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.8 Geometric Objects: geom_violin

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.9 Geometric Objects: geom_point()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.6.10 geom objects can be combined

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +                    
  geom_point(position="jitter", 
             size = 0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.7.1 Working with

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.7.2 Working with stat - the stat_summary() method
text:
1.7.2 Working with stat - the stat_summary() method

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",       
               fun = "mean",         
               colour ="red",        
               size=4)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.7.3 Working with stat - the geom() method
text:
1.7.3 Working with stat - the geom() method

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, x= GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",        
             fun="mean",           
             colour="red",          
             size=4)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.7.4 Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot?
text:
1.7.4 Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot?

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              linewidth=0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.8.1 Working with facet_wrap()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_wrap(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.8.2 facet_grid() function

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20) +
    facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
1.9.1 Working with Coordinate

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.9.2 Changing the y- and x-axis range
text:
1.9.2 Changing the y- and x-axis range

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: 1.9.3 Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: themes
text:
1.9.3 Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: themes

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()
